Line 294: Line 294:
Quebec is a world leader in [[Basic research|fundamental scientific research]], having produced ten [[Nobel Prize|Nobel laureates]] in either physics, chemistry, astrophysics or medicine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cyberpresse.ca/international/dossiers/prix-nobel-2009/200910/10/01-910310-dix-nobel-au-quebec.php |title=Dix Nobel au QuÃ©bec |publisher=Cyberpresse.ca |date= |accessdate=2011-02-23}}</ref> As one of the world leaders in sectors such as aerospace, information technology, biotechnology and pharmaceuticals, Quebec plays a significant role in the world's scientific and technological communities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gouv.qc.ca/portail/quebec/pgs/commun/portrait/economie/sciencestechnologies/?lang=en |title=Science and Technology : Portal of the government of QuÃ©bec |publisher=Gouv.qc.ca |date= |accessdate=2011-02-23}}</ref> Quebec is also active in the development of its energy industries, including [[renewable energy]] such as [[hydropower]] and [[wind power]]. Quebec has had over 9,469 scientific publications in the sector of medicine, biomedical research and engineering since the year 2000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stat.gouv.qc.ca/savoir/index_an.htm |title=QuÃ©bec had 195 triadic inventions patented |publisher=Stat.gouv.qc.ca |date= |accessdate=2011-02-23}}</ref>
Quebec is a world leader in [[Basic research|fundamental scientific research]], having produced ten [[Nobel Prize|Nobel laureates]] in either physics, chemistry, astrophysics or medicine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cyberpresse.ca/international/dossiers/prix-nobel-2009/200910/10/01-910310-dix-nobel-au-quebec.php |title=Dix Nobel au QuÃ©bec |publisher=Cyberpresse.ca |date= |accessdate=2011-02-23}}</ref> As one of the world leaders in sectors such as aerospace, information technology, biotechnology and pharmaceuticals, Quebec plays a significant role in the world's scientific and technological communities.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gouv.qc.ca/portail/quebec/pgs/commun/portrait/economie/sciencestechnologies/?lang=en |title=Science and Technology : Portal of the government of QuÃ©bec |publisher=Gouv.qc.ca |date= |accessdate=2011-02-23}}</ref> Quebec is also active in the development of its energy industries, including [[renewable energy]] such as [[hydropower]] and [[wind power]]. Quebec has had over 9,469 scientific publications in the sector of medicine, biomedical research and engineering since the year 2000.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stat.gouv.qc.ca/savoir/index_an.htm |title=QuÃ©bec had 195 triadic inventions patented |publisher=Stat.gouv.qc.ca |date= |accessdate=2011-02-23}}</ref>

[[Image:HR 8799 planetary system photo.jpg|thumb|300px|View of three exoplanets orbiting a young star [[HR 8799]] 129 light years away are captured using [[Keck Observatory]] near-infrared adaptive optics.]]
+
Quebec was also a strategic choice for the establishment of the [[Canadian Space Agency]]. A total of three Quebeckers have been in space since the creation of the CSA: [[Marc Garneau]], [[Julie Payette]] and [[Guy LalibertÃ©]]. Quebec has also contributed to the creation of some Canadian [[artificial satellite]]s including [[SCISAT-1]], [[ISIS (satellite)|ISIS]], [[Radarsat-1]] and [[Radarsat-2]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asc-csa.gc.ca/eng/educators/resources/radarsat/q-a.asp|title=RADARSAT-1 Climate Change}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asc-csa.gc.ca/eng/satellites/radarsat1/construction.asp|title=Construction and cost}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asc-csa.gc.ca/eng/satellites/scisat/contractors.asp|title=SCISAT Team and partners}}</ref>
Quebec was also a strategic choice for the establishment of the [[Canadian Space Agency]]. A total of three Quebeckers have been in space since the creation of the CSA: [[Marc Garneau]], [[Julie Payette]] and [[Guy LalibertÃ©]]. Quebec has also contributed to the creation of some Canadian [[artificial satellite]]s including [[SCISAT-1]], [[ISIS (satellite)|ISIS]], [[Radarsat-1]] and [[Radarsat-2]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asc-csa.gc.ca/eng/educators/resources/radarsat/q-a.asp|title=RADARSAT-1 Climate Change}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asc-csa.gc.ca/eng/satellites/radarsat1/construction.asp|title=Construction and cost}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asc-csa.gc.ca/eng/satellites/scisat/contractors.asp|title=SCISAT Team and partners}}</ref>
The province is one of the world leaders in the field of [[space science]] and contributed to important discoveries in this field.<ref>{{cite web|format=pdf|url=http://www.investquebec.com/documents/en/secteur/Aerospace.pdf |title=Aerospace in Quebec|publisher=Investissement QuÃ©bec |year=2010|accessdate=2010-05-03}}</ref> One of the most recent is the discovery of the complex [[extrasolar planet]]s system [[HR 8799]]. HR 8799 is the first direct observation of an exoplanet in history.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-canada.ca/nouvelles/science/2010/12/09/001-exoplanete-hr8799e-marois.shtml|title=Une quatriÃ¨me planÃ¨te autour de l'Ã©toile HR 8799}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-canada.ca/nouvelles/science/2009/01/21/001-Embargo-scientifiques2008.shtml|title=Un trio d'astrophysiciens rÃ©compensÃ©}}</ref> Olivier Daigle and Claude Carignan, astrophysicists from [[UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al]] have invented the most sensitive astronomical camera in the world.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nouvelles.umontreal.ca/campus/prix-et-distinctions/20100518-olivier-daigle-nomme-personnalite-de-la-semaine-la-presse-radio-canada.html|title=Olivier Daigle nommÃ© PersonnalitÃ© de la semaine La Presse - Radio-Canada}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nouvelles.umontreal.ca/recherche/sciences-technologies/la-nasa-acquiert-une-camera-concue-a-ludem.html|title=La NASA acquiert une camÃ©ra conÃ§ue Ã  l'UdeM}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nouvelles.umontreal.ca/campus/prix-et-distinctions/20100426-quebec-science-remet-le-prix-du-public-decouverte-de-lannee-2009-a-un-chercheur-detoiles.html|title=QuÃ©bec Science remet le Prix du public DÃ©couverte de l'annÃ©e 2009 Ã  un chercheur d'Ã©toiles}}</ref> This new sensitive camera is 500 times more powerful than those currently on the markets.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-canada.ca/nouvelles/science/2009/09/29/001-camera-udm-nasa.shtml|title=La NASA premiÃ¨re cliente}}</ref> The [[Mont MÃ©gantic Observatory]] was recently equipped with this powerful camera.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cyberpresse.ca/le-soleil/actualites/science-et-technologie/200910/05/01-908724-un-oeil-de-lynx-pour-la-nasa-grace-a-un-levisien.php|title=Un oeil de lynx pour la NASA grÃ¢ce Ã  un LÃ©visien}}</ref>
The province is one of the world leaders in the field of [[space science]] and contributed to important discoveries in this field.<ref>{{cite web|format=pdf|url=http://www.investquebec.com/documents/en/secteur/Aerospace.pdf |title=Aerospace in Quebec|publisher=Investissement QuÃ©bec |year=2010|accessdate=2010-05-03}}</ref> One of the most recent is the discovery of the complex [[extrasolar planet]]s system [[HR 8799]]. HR 8799 is the first direct observation of an exoplanet in history.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-canada.ca/nouvelles/science/2010/12/09/001-exoplanete-hr8799e-marois.shtml|title=Une quatriÃ¨me planÃ¨te autour de l'Ã©toile HR 8799}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-canada.ca/nouvelles/science/2009/01/21/001-Embargo-scientifiques2008.shtml|title=Un trio d'astrophysiciens rÃ©compensÃ©}}</ref> Olivier Daigle and Claude Carignan, astrophysicists from [[UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al]] have invented the most sensitive astronomical camera in the world.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nouvelles.umontreal.ca/campus/prix-et-distinctions/20100518-olivier-daigle-nomme-personnalite-de-la-semaine-la-presse-radio-canada.html|title=Olivier Daigle nommÃ© PersonnalitÃ© de la semaine La Presse - Radio-Canada}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nouvelles.umontreal.ca/recherche/sciences-technologies/la-nasa-acquiert-une-camera-concue-a-ludem.html|title=La NASA acquiert une camÃ©ra conÃ§ue Ã  l'UdeM}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nouvelles.umontreal.ca/campus/prix-et-distinctions/20100426-quebec-science-remet-le-prix-du-public-decouverte-de-lannee-2009-a-un-chercheur-detoiles.html|title=QuÃ©bec Science remet le Prix du public DÃ©couverte de l'annÃ©e 2009 Ã  un chercheur d'Ã©toiles}}</ref> This new sensitive camera is 500 times more powerful than those currently on the markets.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-canada.ca/nouvelles/science/2009/09/29/001-camera-udm-nasa.shtml|title=La NASA premiÃ¨re cliente}}</ref> The [[Mont MÃ©gantic Observatory]] was recently equipped with this powerful camera.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cyberpresse.ca/le-soleil/actualites/science-et-technologie/200910/05/01-908724-un-oeil-de-lynx-pour-la-nasa-grace-a-un-levisien.php|title=Un oeil de lynx pour la NASA grÃ¢ce Ã  un LÃ©visien}}</ref>
